title: World News:  Experienced Pilot  Was at the Controls  ----  By Wenxin Fan
text:
HONG KONG -- One of China's most experienced commercial pilots was seated in the cockpit of the China Eastern Airlines Boeing 737-800 that departed the southwestern Chinese city of Kunming just after 1 p.m. Monday afternoon.

Next to him was a much younger pilot with a promising pedigree.

The airline hasn't disclosed their names, but Phoenix Weekly, a magazine run by a state-controlled television broadcaster, identified the captain as Yang Hongda, the son of a senior pilot, and the first officer as Zhang Zhengping, a veteran pilot nearing retirement.

The Wall Street Journal hasn't been able to reach their families. China Eastern Airlines didn't immediately respond to a request for comment.
